title: Terraform on IBM Cloud docs
introduction: Explore the capabilities of the IBM Cloud Provider plug-in for Terraform. You can get started by installing the Terraform CLI and configure the IBM Cloud Provider plug-in. Then, you can try out a tutorial to create an IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service or Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud cluster by using Terraform. You can also choose one of the IBM-provided Terraform templates to get started with the provisioning of other IBM Cloud services with Terraform, such as IBM Cloud Object Storage or IBM Key Protect.

section_recommended.title: Set up the Terraform CLI and IBM Cloud Provider plug-in
section_recommended.description: Install the Terraform CLI and configure the IBM Cloud Provider plug-in for Terraform so that you can start working with services in IBM Cloud.

section_recommended.title: Find supported Terraform resources and data sources
section_recommended.description: Explore the Terraform resources and data sources that you can use to provision, update, and delete IBM Cloud services with Terraform.

section_recommended.title: Browse Terraform templates
section_recommended.description: Explore the sample Terraform templates, onboard them to your private catalogs, and try them using Schematics.

section_recommended.title: Create Kubernetes and OpenShift clusters
section_recommended.description: Learn how to create single and multizone IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service or Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud clusters with Terraform.

section_recommended.title: Create a virtual server in a VPC
section_recommended.description: Use Terraform on IBM Cloud to provision a VPC, set up networking for your VPC, and provision a virtual server for VPC in your IBM Cloud account.

section_recommended.title: Create a classic virtual server instance
section_recommended.description: See how you can use Terraform on IBM Cloud to provision a classic virtual server instance.
